title: Who’s Driving Climate Change? New Data Catalogs 72,000 Polluters and Counting
Show HN: I made myself a HN site in English and Chinese, so I can read more HN
text:
It is a single static html page, I also provide jsonfeed[0] and rss[1], and I incidentally support Traditional Chinese[2], Japanese[3], and English only[4], but I don't think I currently have English users or Japanese users.

I tried to get `og:image` at the same time as getting hacker news' post to display the image, and I used deepl's API for translation.

If you happen to need this, feel free to use it!

There are more hn topic subsite like Show HN[5], Ask HN[6], Best HN [7], HN Front[8] etc.

[0]: https://hnnew.buzzing.cc/feed.json

[1]: https://hnnew.buzzing.cc/feed.xml

[2]: https://hnnew.buzzing.cc/zh-Hant/

[3]: https://hnnew.buzzing.cc/ja/

[4]: https://hnnew.buzzing.cc/en/

[5]: https://showhn.buzzing.cc/

[6]: https://askhn.buzzing.cc/

[7]: https://hn.buzzing.cc/

[8]: https://hnfront.buzzing.cc/

title: Ask HN: Blind folks, Would you prefer a CLI app over a web app?
text:
I'm contemplating on building an application which would serve people with disabilities. Majority of my users would be technically inclined.

Has anyone explored the accessibility benefits or lack there of in creating a ssh app instead of a web app ?

Especially serving those with visual disability, Considering there have been decades of investment in console screen readers would an CLI app be more beneficial than a text focused web app?

I've seen few blind users on HN, If you are one then would you prefer a CLI app over a web app? Few examples for either case would be much appreciated.
